main event: A circular object was observed rapidly crossing the sky in Hawthorne, California on September 6, 1955.
interesting points: The object paused mid-flight before descending and making a ninety degree turn., The observation lasted for about 10 minutes., The witness's conclusion was that the object was likely a balloon or possibly an aircraft., There were several references to bright lights observed in the area during other dates., The report mentioned the possibility of a civilian blimp operating in the area around the time of the sighting.
witness description: William McDougall, employee at American Airlines Communications Dept
